Flask-canjs-i18n-boilerplate API Documentation¶

Users¶

GET /users¶

Get All users with pagination.

Return :users, has_next, has_prev, current_page
GET /users/(user_id)¶

Get one user by user’s id. :param user_id: user’s id(INT) :return: user, is_current, is_following, followers_cnt, following_cnt

PUT /users/(user_id)¶

Update user information.

@login_required

Parameters:
  • user_id –
Return :

user, password_incorrect, status
DELETE /users/(user_id)¶

Delete user.

@login_required

Parameters:
  • user_id –
Return :

Authentications¶

GET /authentications¶

Get an authenticated status.

@login_required

Return :
POST /authentications¶

Login user.

Return :status(True : Login Success | False : Login Failed) email(user’s email when status is True.)
DELETE /authentications¶

Logout user.

@login_required

Return :

Connections¶

POST /connections/facebook¶

Post a message to facebook.

@login_required

Return :status(True: when message sent success. | False: when message sent failed.)
DELETE /connections/facebook¶

Disconnect facebook connection.

@login_required

Return :status(True: when disconnection success. | False: when disconnection failed.)
GET /connections/facebook¶

Get facebook connection.

@login_required

Return :has_facebkk_connection

Filters¶

GET /filters/user/current¶

Returns current user or empty object.

Return :user
GET /filters/user/email/(email)¶

Filter user by email for check exist user. :param email: valid email. :return: email that requested, status(True : user exist, False : user not exist)

Followers¶

POST /followers¶

Follow User.

@login_required

Return :status(True : follow success, False : follow failed) email(following user email)
GET /followers¶

Get followers with pagination.

Return :followers, has_next, current_page
DELETE /followers/(user_id)¶

Unfollow User.

@login_required

Parameters:
  • user_id –
Return :

status(True : unfollow success, False : unfollow failed) email(unfollowing user email)

Following¶

GET /following¶

Get following with pagination.

Return :following, has_next, current_page
